item.title: PhilHealth execs behind questionable advance payments, IT budget may face graft charges --Drilon
item.description: Senate Minority Leader Franklin Drilon on Wednesday warned that erring PhilHealth officials proven to have a hand in the questionable Interim Reimbursement Mechanism (IRM) and alleged overpricing of IT equipment could be slapped with graft charges.

item.title: Palace: 50% of public school classrooms in NCR to be used as temporary quarantine facilities
item.description: Half of public school classrooms in Metro Manila will be used as temporary quarantine facilities as the government strengthens its response to the COVID-19 crisis.

item.title: CHR demands transparency, urges PhilHealth to prove funds are used properly
item.description: “We demand transparency and assurance that public funds entrusted to the corporation are properly disbursed and accounted for,” CHR spokesperson Jacqueline Ann de Guia said.

item.title: Philippines COVID-19 tally tops 143,000 with 4,444 new cases
item.description: The Philippines tally of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases jumped to 143,749 on Wednesday after the Department of Health (DOH) announced 4,444 new infections.

item.title: AFP reaffirms commitment to International Humanitarian Law
item.description: The Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) reaffirmed its commitment to humanitarian law amid the observance of the International Humanitarian Law Day on Wednesday, August 12.

item.title: UP experts urge gov't to extend MECQ in NCR for 2 more weeks
item.description: Experts from the University of the Philippines on Wednesday suggested that the modified enhanced community quarantine in the National Capital Region be extended for another two weeks to curb the spread of COVID-19.

item.title: Russia vaccine vs. COVID-19 should pass Philippine regulations first before trials --DOH
item.description: The government will still subject the Russia-made vaccine against COVID-19 to regulatory procedures before clearing it for clinical trials even amid President Rodrigo Duterte's apparent interest in participating in it, the Department of Health (DOH) said Wednesday.

item.title: PhilHealth chief Morales, VP Del Rosario leave House hearing due to health issues
item.description: Si General Morales daw po ay umalis dahil medyo masama ang pakiramdam,” Anakalusugan party-list Representative Mike Defensor said during the hearing.

item.title: Ex-PhilHealth chief on corruption claims: Malakas ang mafia sa loob
item.description: Former Philippine Health Insurance Corp. chairperson and now Iloilo 1st District Rep. Janette Loreto-Garin on Wednesday shared her encounter with corruption issues in the state insurer during her stint.

item.title: Zubiri to push for up to P5B budget for COVID-19 vaccine under Bayanihan 2
item.description: "We're going to push for an increase for the budget for vaccination program... Kung hindi naman natin ito kayang ikaltas sa ibang industriya, I'm sure papayag naman si [Finance] Secretary [Carlos] Dominguez na magdadagdag tayo," Senate Majority Leader Juan Miguel Zubiri told reporters.

item.title: Exec admits PhilHealth IT system not 'fool-proof'
item.description: An official of the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. (PhilHealth) on Wednesday admitted that the agency's information technology (IT) system is not absolutely "fool-proof" amid allegations of irregularities within the agency.

item.title: Thai paper s claim on Philippines' COVID-19 situation motivated by tourism competition -Palace
item.description: Competition in the tourism industry may have prompted a Thai newspaper to brand the Philippines as the “land of COVID-19,” Malacañang said Wednesday.

item.title: Bello: Employees required to wear face shields beginning August 15
item.description: "Effective August 15, hindi lang face mask ang gamitin mo, kasama na ang face shield. So, 'yun ang bagong protocol ngayon," Labor Secretary Silvestre Bello III said. "Para kasi 'yung contamination o transmission, hindi naman limited lang sa ilong eh. Puwede rin sa mata," he added.

item.title: Chinese city says woman tests positive for COVID-19 again after recovering months ago
item.description: BEIJING - Jingzhou city in China's central province of Hubei reported on Wednesday a coronavirus case where the person turned positive again after recovering months ago, the Jingzhou government said.

item.title: Several PhilHealth execs to allow AMLC to check their bank accounts
item.description: Several officials of the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. (PhilHealth) on Wednesday said they will allow the Anti-Money Laundering Council (AMLC) to check their bank accounts to prove they are not engaged in corruption.
